title: Guardian of Icecrown behavior is odd
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
Guardian of Icecrown does not gain Blood Tap by actually using the spell, it just seems to get more stacks of its buff randomly sometimes even while cc'd.

This makes the mob stack it very fast and grow almost as big as the boss room as well as do some very high damage.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Engage KT to 40% hp
2. Wait for the guardians to spawn. With many characters multibox'd to shackle, freezing trap, turn undead, tank.
3. See them not use the Blood Tap spell at all (it's 200 physical damage on a target + apply a stack of buff on self)
4. They gain stacks of the buff at random

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

NPC: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=16441
Spell: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=28470

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
- Firstly the spell should do the correct amount of damage (I'm aware them using the spell was intentionally turned off by twow devs long ago because it was overtuned and the fight was unbeatable)  https://github.com/vmangos/core/pull/2396 this also affects unstoppable abominations mortal would, for that one the damage was hackfix'd instead of turned off completely

- Secondly once the damage is fixed, the mobs should be reverted to their correct AI where they cast blood tap on the enemy victim on a 15 sec cooldown and gain blood tap stacks that way (And that way only! They are not supposed to gain stacks on leaving cc or swapping targets)

title: Drain Soul has halved spell power scaling
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**

Warlock's Affliction spell Drain Soul has only **50% spell power scaling** (10% every 3 seconds for 15 seconds, 50% total) while it should have **100% spell power scaling** (20% every 3 sec), as all single target spells with channel **duration 3,5 seconds or longer**. This scaling is incorrect for **ranks 2, 3 and 4**. Rank 1 scaling is correct.

![image](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/87695943/5f5af0e8-287c-4dd5-b826-394011752869)
455 / 5 = 91 damage per tick

![image](https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/assets/87695943/3536061d-e423-41dd-9e1c-28c9102fefab)
723 spell power gives only 72 damage per tick, so it's 163 instead of 235 damage per tick, making the spell ~30% weaker in my case

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Find a suitable victim.
2. Cast Drain Soul rank 2/3/4, unbuffed/talented for clarity.
3. See that it only scales with 10% of your spell power per tick, instead of 20%.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

Spell: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=8288 rank 2
Spell: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=8289 rank 3
Spell: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=11675 rank 4

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**

The Drain Soul ranks 2-4 should scale twice as much. Halving spell power scaling is only used for **life draining** spells like Drain Life, Siphon Life and Death Coil.

title: Dungeon bosses with Boss Level, do not respect rogue tank avoidance
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
I was tanking Black Morass on my rogue earlier, and Antnormi landed (at least) 9 consecutive hits through my avoidance, despite being unhittable on paper. This happened while I was not stunned, nor facing away from the boss, and I kept attacking the boss during this time while the healer did everything in their power to keep me alive (which was doomed to fail).

I am not certain of the exact course of the fight, as my combat log wasn't scrollable far enough, but it _might_ have something to do with the fact that I used an engineering Masterwork Training Dummy to avoid the stun/fear effect the boss does, by activating it mere moments before the cast went through.

If this has something to do with the somewhat recent change to rogue avoidance being nullified while soloing bosses (or doing them in small groups), in our case we had a full group of 5 people. Besides, shouldn't that change be retired already, since after Flourish was given a cooldown it should no longer be possible to maintain full unhittability for an extended period of time.

Additionally, the elemental mobs of the dungeon and the boss Mossheart are all immune to Agitating Poison, making tanking them much more difficult for rogues. I get the lore-based reasoning of having certain mobs be immune to certain damage types, but in this case they're being made immune to a specific tank (though admittedly very niche). Perhaps Agitating Poison could be made to generate its threat regardless of immunity to the damage component?

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Tank Antnormi as a rogue
2. (Possibly: use Target Dummy)
3. Use whatever avoidance cooldowns you have
4. Observe the boss mauling through them like your avoidance does not exist

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

NPC: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=65125

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
Bosses should respect avoidance, especially during ordinary runs.
Bosses should not be made immune to the threat mechanics of specific tanks, unless in a raid environment where it is reasonable to assume someone else can commit themselves to tanking an encounter. 5-person dungeon groups don't necessarily have anyone that could stand in for a tank that can not tank a fight due to design choices.
_Possibly:_ The rogue avoidance nullification effect should be retired, as it is no longer needed after further changes have been introduced to rogue tanking.

title: Suggestion - Totem of the Stonebreaker is Undertuned
body:
Currently Totem of the Stonebreaker feels fairly weak for the tier of content that it drops from (T2) the proc rate appears to be about 10% 

This means that if you cast shocks on cooldown for 1 minute (assuming 6s CD) you're looking at about a 65% chance to see it proc a single time in that minute.

Even if you do take the Talent and once again are casting shocks on CD (5s) you have just under a 72% chance of seeing it proc in that one minute. 

This does not take into consideration shocks being resisted which is extremely common for Enhancement Shamans especially in the endgame content. During the 10 seconds the buff is active your average DPS will be up by about 7pts. I would advocate for the proc rate being higher to offset the high chance that enhancement shamans have to get their shocks resisted.

title: Wyvern Sting dot gets removed by Immolation Trap dot
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
Wyvern Sting applies a dot that deals nature damage over 12 seconds. As the spell description states, only one sting per hunter can be active on a target. Applying Serpent Sting will remove the Wyvern Sting dot, as it should. Applying Immolation Trap dot to the target also removes the Wyvern Sting dot, which should not happen.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Place an Immolation Trap.
2. Fire a Wyvern Sting on a mob and either wait for it to run out or wake it up with an autoshot/trueshot/arcane shot
3. See the Wyvern Sting dot applied to the mob after the cc ends.
4. Have the mob walk into your Immolation Trap.
5. Application of Immolation Trap dot instantly removes Wyvern Sting dot.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**
Immolation Trap rank 4:
https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=14304
Wyvern Sting rank 2:
https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=20940

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
Mob should have both the dots of Wyvern Sting and Immolation Trap on it.


EDIT:
Tested with different ranks of Wyvern Sting and Immolation Trap, same result.
Tested with Wyvern Sting and Explosive Trap, works as it should, doesnt replace Wyvern Sting dot.
Problem thus appears to be with Immolation Trap, not with Wyvern Sting.

title: Dampen Magic interacts too strongly with DoTs
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**

The mage's spell called **Dampen Magic** does apply it's damage reduction to every dot tick instead of spell overall, what makes this 10 minutes cheap buff to negate almost half of a dot's damage.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Find an unbuffed mage
2. Cast dot at him (doesnt matter magic or curse)
3. Calculate damage
4. Buff a mage with dampen magic
5. Cast the same dot at him
6. Calculate damage mitigation

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**


2. Dampen Magic (rank 5) - https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=10174
3. Corruption (rank 6) - https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=11672
4. Corruption (rank 7) - https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=25311
5. Magic Attunement - talent to increase DM effect - https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=12606

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**

Dampen magic should have the exact formula and affect spell overall, not every tick:

> Spells are Modified by **SpellCoeffcient** * (**AmplifyMagicValue** - **DampenMagicValue**)
> If this reduces total spell damage by more than 50%, the effect is capped at 50%.
> Bandage and HealthPotions are not affected by Dampen/Amplify.

To prove that formula and statement about not affecting every tick being correct here is an old vanilla famous video:
https://youtu.be/Mh_cLN66zHA?t=619  (10:19 timing)
Mage buffed by dampen magic fights a lock. Due to lock being 58 lvl he is using corruption **rank 6** (**666** damage pet 18seconds). It's clearly visible that mage recieves damage of **108** per tick.
1. According to my formula: 1 * (0-90) = minus 90 clear amplify damage reduction to spell overall.
2. 108x6 = **648** damage per 18 seconds will be recieved by buffed mage from a 58 lvl lock using rank 6 corruption.
3. Without dampen it will be 738 damage total what seems accurate taking in account his low lvl, spell rank used and explains dampen magic behaviour that works alongside provided formula.

Now how it works on TwoW:
1. https://i.imgur.com/gh0BtdP.mp4 - 298 spd 60 lvl lock uses **rank 7** (**822** damage pet 18seconds) corruption doing **186** damage to mage withiut DM = 186 x 6= **1116** damage overall
2. https://i.imgur.com/XKnVhZp.mp4 - 298 spd 60 lvl lock uses **rank 7** (**822** damage pet 18seconds) corruption doing **96** damage to mage buffed with DM (no talent) = 96 x 6 = **576** damage overall
3. Damage reduction almost doubled vs vanilla spell behavior.
4. Conclusion - geared TWoW 60 lock with rank 7 dot does lower damage than retail 58 lock with rank 6 dot due to bugged dampen magic.

Result: TWow dampen magic affects every tick and should be fixed according to provided formula.

@twowTurtReynolds Mark of the worgen suffers from both the exclusivity bug ( #3994 ) based on its effect, and the no coexisting bug ( #5401 , #4592 ) based on its buff's icon and visual effect

refresher: 
exclusivity bug = the buffs are both placed on the unit but it only benefits from the stronger one when they have the same effect (when both give ap, you only get ap from the highest one)
coexisting bug = applying a buff removes existing buffs that have the same icon and visual (the visual here being the howling animation and sound, not the transformation to worgen which is an effect)

core bug btw

It's definitely the no coexisting bug, rather than the exclusivity bug. Furious Howl removes Call of Worgen because they share the same icon, rather than applying both but only getting the effect from stronger of the two. Whether Call of Worgen suffers from exclusivity bug remains to be seen (literally untestable now)

title: "Allows 5% of your mana regeneration to continue while casting" from items doesn't work with more than 1 point in priest "Meditation" talent.
body:
I'm a lvl 60 holy priest.

1. got 3/3 points in Meditation
2. don't have any cloak, rings or amulet equipped.
3. Get 21 mana every 2 seconds while casting (as per BetterCharacterStats description - spirit regen 61mp2 when not casting, 15% of that is 9; got 30mp5 from gear so 12mp2, 9+12=21, that's 21 mana every 2 seconds, all checks out).
4. I equip 2 rings, amulet and cloak which all combined give me 20% mana regen while casting, 5mp5 and 23 spirit.
5. BetterCharacterStats now reports I have 68mp2 spirit regen when not casting, 35% mana regen while casting total, 35 mp5 regen and 14 mp2 regen and should be getting 37 mana every 2 seconds now (68x0.35 + 14 = 37).
Yet I only get 24 mana every 2 seconds so only 3 more than before equipping all those items (1mp2 from 23 spirit from Meditation's 15% and 2mp2 from 5mp5). Adding items 1 by 1 didn't help anything, 5% didn't kick in at any step.

First Impression - % regen while casting stat from all those items straight up doesn't work.

Items I equipped:

https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=2043
https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=60798
https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=60564
https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=83465

But I tried reseting talents:

6. 0/0 points in Meditation, all my gear equipped except for those 4 items.
7. Should have 12mp2 while casting now as per BCS report (from mp5 gear pieces) - checks out.
8. Adding 7spi/5% ring - reported mp2 goes from 12 to 15 - checks out.
9. Adding 16spi/5%ring - reported mp2 goes from 15 to 18 - checks out.
10. Adding 5mp5/5% neck - reported mp2 goes from 18 to 24 - checks out (15% regen from gear now, 0% from Meditation)
11. Adding 5% cloak - reported mp2 goes from 24 to 27 - checks out (20% regen from gear now, 0% from Meditation) - got 3 more mp2 now than I had at the begining with 3/3 Meditation and 4/4 gear.

Conclusion - gear % regen works, something not right with Meditation.

12. Adding 1/3 Meditation - BCS reports 35% regen! (should 25%) and 37 mp2 when casting (as much as it was reporting with 3/3 Meditation in the begining), but actual regen I have is 31mp2 (from 27mp2 so +4), looks like first 1st point in Meditation works although BCS reports wrong, as if 3/3 Med). 

13. Adding 2/3 Meditation - BCS reports 45% regen! (should 30%) and 44 mp2 when casting - actual regen I have 20mp2 when casting (-11). looks like 2nd Med point is working but breaks gear benefits (losing 15 mp2 from gear but gaining 4mp2 from 2nd Med point = net loss 11).

14. Removed all +5% gear - only lost 2mp2 (from neck's 5mp5) (18mp2 now). Looks like % regen from gear not working indeed.

15. Equipped all gear back - went back to 20mp2 (as much as in step 13)

16. Adding 3/3 Meditation - BCS reports 35% now (as it should) and 37mp2 (as at the very beginning) but only have 24mp2 actually (as in the beginning).

17. Removing 4 pieces - gets me back to 21mp2 (as in the begining before equipping pieces - at step 3).

At first I thought maybe 20% is cap but with 3/3 Meditation, adding a single gear piece doesn't increase mp2 as it should. It looks like Meditation points work as they should on their own, it's just that 2nd point breaks benefits from gear.

I'm having this exact same problem on Raxxa, an Orc Warrior.  I think it's very important to note here that I bought the Goblin Brainwashing device before level 60, and it was working _beautifully_.  Last night I hit level 60 and am now running into the issues reported here and in so many other places.  Yes, I've cleared my WDB cache many times before attempting to save my specs. Though this may not be a terribly common occurrence, it still strikes me as something that needs addressing.  I can understand wiping specializations if one is not using the full number of a talent points, but a second empty specialization should not have the same effect.

@Kangaroux do you know what is blizzlike?

The only resource I can find is this TP calc: https://www.wowhead.com/classic/hunter-pet-training/AQE8Bg

If you move the level slider at max loyalty it goes up by 5 TP per level. It seemed like prior to max loyalty I was getting TP equal to my pet's level. I don't know if that's intended or not. 

Every wiki I read has the formula `(pet level) * (loyalty - 1)` as the potential max TP amount. I can't find any info on how much you're supposed to gain per level

Everything you need to know is in the above formula already.
Your pet gains 0-5 tp per level up depending on its loyalty. (5 points at max loyalty, 0 points at loyalty 1). It also gains tp equal to its current level when the loyalty increases.

You gained somewhere around 30 tp when your pet increased its loyalty. You now gain 5 tp when your pet levels up. For a max amount of 300 tp (= loyalty 6 - 1 = 5 x level 60).

It's blizzlike and also working as intended.

comments.body: Replicated on VMaNGOS. Same goes for Lightning Shield, and probably all reflective damage.
I cannot remember on classic if defensive stance was indeed supposed to reduce thorn effects' damage or not... if someone can find some video evidence, that would be stellar.

In these videos they are probably using [Rank 2 Thorns](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=782) and [Rank 1 Retribution Aura](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=7294).
Rank 2 Thorns hit for 6, but here you can see it hitting for 5; rarely will you see a 6: https://youtu.be/PwHgq5jQef8?t=1085
Rank 1 Retribution Aura hits for 5, but here you can see it hitting for 4 and 5: https://youtu.be/PwHgq5jQef8?t=2877
This is an indication that Defensive Stance does in fact reduce reflected damage.

Thank you. I was talking with a warlock player, about how DoTs on turtle always round down here, but on classic will average themselves out: if your spellpower has the dot wanting to do 10.2 damage, it will do 10 damage four times and 11 one time, to average to 10.2. Turtle does not do this currently.

With that bug fix, we would see defensive stance'd crystal spire do both 10s and 11s, and perhaps https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/issues/4271 would be fixed too.

body:

[[Quest: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=40981)](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=40981)


This is the current text decription:
___
I have heard rumors from the Deathstalkers that the ambush was facilitated by Captain Veller stationed at Freyshear Keep. If this information is true, then this man was the murderer of my brother.

A very valuable piece of jewelry was taken from Franklin's corpse; the Blackheart Necklace. I have no doubt in my mind that this pompous man has taken the necklace.

Freyshear Keep can be found far to the west, isolated on an island that looms overtop of Ravenshire. Kill him, and recover the necklace.
___


This is what I would enjoy. I've stylized and the text and its language to fit the setting, and also provided useful information about how to get on an island (players who don't know they need to go there by the bridge might lose a lot of time trying to swim there):
___
Whispers from the Deathstalkers speak of an orchestrated ambush, with suspicions pointing toward Captain Veller, who commands at the ominous Freyshear Keep. If these murmurs hold truth, it is he who orchestrated the demise of my kin.

In the aftermath of this treacherous act, a cherished relic, the Blackheart Necklace, was pilfered from my brother's remains. I am resolute in my belief that this pompous man, Captain Veller, is the possessor of this stolen heirloom.

Journey to the distant east, where Freyshear Keep stands solitary on an elevated island, casting its ominous shadow over Ravenshire, tethered to the mainland by a precarious bridge. Confront Captain Veller, bring retribution for my fallen brother, and reclaim the Blackheart Necklace.

May the shadows enshroud your path and justice guide your hand.
___

The expected behaviour would be that ignite is applyed instantly when a fire spell crits and then it ticks twice after 2 and 4 seconds. Is there any information on this issue?

After testing this for some time in raid and solo/group content I can tell ignite is not working as it should right now. 

The major drawback is that the amount of times it resets tick damage because of the bugged refresh window makes the damage from Ignite significally lower than it should. Note that while the debuff may still be up on the target, the damage will reset at times. 

For solo content there's some notable side effects aswell. While being solo you should be able to stack your own ignite during that 4 second window but that is not working right now and you'll only achieve stacks if you manage to crit constantly with Scorch (1.5s cast no travel time) or Blastwave/Fireblast (instant casts-no travel time)

**This is how ignite should work.**

-  Any fire spell critical hit from a mage with Ignite talent (5/5 we have 100% chance) should apply an ignite debuff on the target that will damage the target for 40% of the damage made by that spell and this debuff will tick twice after 2 and 4 seconds doing half of that damage evenly split (so 20% damage from the crit per tick). 

In TWoW Ignite ticks 3 times at 0-2-4 seconds for 20% each (60% total) <- Either wrong tooltip due to undocumented changes on this talent or bugged behavior.  The first tick shouldn't be happening.

- The ignite debuff will show on the target the moment a crit lands and will dissapear 4 seconds later (right after 2nd tick) if no other crits happen.

In TWoW the debuff is gone after the third tick during the first ignite. If it refreshes it will go after 2 ticks. This is the correct behavior.

So if a mage crits for 2400 damage, the ignite should tick for 480 twice (40% of 2400 = 960 -> 480 per tick) 2 and 4 seconds after crit.
In TWoW if a mage crits for 2400 damage, the ignite ticks for 480 three times. Instaly and 2 and 4 seconds after.

- If the mage or any other mage with Ignite talent (lets assume 5/5 again for 100% chance) - crits on the target with an ignite debuff up, the damage from that crit will add to the original Ignite and the Ignite debuff timer will reset (so it ticks twice again)

-  An important note here is that refreshes won't change the pace Ignite ticks come - those will keep coming every 2 seconds after the original crit/ignite started. So several crits between crits will add all that extra damage to the tick during the next tick.

So if the same mage/other mage crits for 3000 ( 40% of 3000 =1200 -> 600 per tick) on that same target while Ignite debuff is up, the new ignite will add to the original extending the duration to allow 2 new ticks happen and the tick damage added to the original tick damage.

If 2 crits happen between ticks, the damage from each crit will add. So if 2 mages crits for 3000 (600 per tick each mage), that extra 1200 per tick will add to the ignite on the next tick.

In TWoW this may not happen, the stack window is either bugged or shorter than intended/debuff duration. So despite having Ignite the tick damage may reset to the newly added tick damage as if the ignite debuff dropped from the target for a moment.

This process will keep happening until 5 stacks of Ignite are reached. At that point added damage from new Ignites won't add but they will refresh the duration. Whenever Ignite refreshes, the damage from "old ticks" will prevail while the Ignite is alive. To say it another way, the original crit and its consequent 2 ticks won't drop from the ignite tick after those tick twice. For aslong the ignite is up, the damage keeps adding up to 5 stacks of ignite.
This should be fixed in the next maintenance.

title: Gilneas: Silenceable Bosses and Freezeable Packmaster Ragetooth
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
Inside the Gilneas dungeon, as an arcane mage with Improved Counterspell Rank 2, I can interrupt AND silence bosses as if they were trash mobs or overworld mobs.

Also, as a frost specced mage, at least Packmaster Ragetooth can be farmed with a simple AoE blizzard! Freezable too.


**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

**Silence Bug**
1. Play a mage.
2. Spec arcane to get Improved Counterspell (Rank 2 preferred).
3. Get to Gilneas and be able to fight in the dungeon.
4. Cast Counterspell on a boss.
5. The boss is now Silenced and Interrupted, when normally bosses are immune to these effects.

**Freezable and Slowable Bug?**
1. Play a mage.
2. Spec frost and get chilled effects.
3. Use Blizzard, Frost Nova, or any Frost Spell on at least the Worgen Boss (I haven't tested it with the other bosses. I play fire and arcane)
4. Ragetooth can be frozen and slowed by frosts effects, when normally bosses are never impacted by these effects excluding the damage.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

NPC:

1. https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=61418
2. https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=61419
3. https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=61420    (x2 - Both Silenceable and Freezable)
4. https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=61421
5. https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=61422
6. https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=61423
7. https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=61605
8. https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=61263
9. https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=61264

Spell:
https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=12598


**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
Counterspell Issue (Especially in Arcane):
You play as a mage, and any time a boss attempts to cast a spell (Or anytime really if you just want to see them silenced), it's both interruptible and also able to be silenced with Improved Counterspell. Easy, simple, straight to the point. Makes the dungeon with a mage even easier than expected. I assume that priest's silence also would work? Just a thought.

Example: Judge Sutherland is able to be silenced, and when counterspelled, it starts a cooldown for all of his similarly schooled spells, reducing him to melee AI. Furthermore, he's completely silenced too with Improved Counterspell. Tested on all the bosses, every single one was able to be silenced after I saw Sutherland could be interrupted and silenced as Arcane.

If I recall correctly, this wasn't an issue in Hateforge Quarry OR Crescent Grove either, so perhaps this was just missed in Gilneas.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Freezable and Slowable?:
Frost spells slowed the Packmaster Ragetooth, and I could kill him like an AoE farm. With max spec in Frost, he was freezable and slowable with Frost Nova and Blizzard. This was before your most recent reset however, I haven't done Gilneas again afterwards. Maybe a quality check for difficulty, immunities and resistances are in order?

Changelog:
> Added race restrictions to Stormwind and Orgrimmar's Portable Wormhole Generators for Engineering to prevent cross-faction abuse.

This will mean you won't be able to make or have SW portal recipes or devices as a horde and vice versa.

I would also like to be compensated for the silver lost on each book, as they are quite costly as we level up on top of the other skills.

1. Have a lvl 33 warlock, with a voidwalker that has all skills learned through books.
2.  Level to 34, and purchase consume shadows rank 3.
3.  Take a portal from Org to UC
4. Take a FP to tarren mill.
5. If you have the voidwalker already summoned, check his skills. if not, summon him and check his skills.

Crusader strike adds spellpower to a target, as if you were wearing the spellpower.

However, different Spells in the game each have their own spellpower coefficients, which is factored into:
 result damage = base damage + coeff * spellpower
 
 If the coeff is 0, then result = base damage always. This is the case of this weapon.

However, result damage does get +% buffs factored in always. I just tested sanctity aura and yes, that part works.

title: "Thandol Span" quest not completable.
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**

For the quest "Thandol Span" that follows from "Caravan meets Caravan".

It has 3 objectives: Defeat Scarlet Recruits, have the scarlet insignia ring, and bring Vladeus Springriver back to Menethil.
There are issues with the scarlet Recruits spawning right after being killed and getting quest objective credit for killing them, but you can still talk to Vladeus and get him to follow you and run away from them instead of fighting infinite spawns. But you cannot bring Vladeus to Menethil because he cannot zone with you into Wetlands.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Accept the quest, have ring in inventory, and head north to Thandol Span
2.  Approach the bridge and fight the Scarlet Recruits that spawn.
3.  After a few moments Vladeus spawns as well. Fight him until he turns friendly.
4. Speak to Vladeus, and select the dialogue option to get him to follow you.
5. Step 4 is when the Scarlet recruits spawn again when it seems like they should not.
6. Whether you fight the Scarlet Recruits again or not, walking into Wetlands with Vladeus following you results in him not following you as you enter the Wetlands zone and "zone in" to the area, he can't follow and "despawns". Walking back into Thandol Span shows him still there and if you go back quick enough he's still following you. Take too long and he'll walk back to his spawn point, and scarlet recruits will spawn again but seem not to interact unless you attack.
7. Getting him to follow again changes nothing.
8. Going all the way back to Menethil Harbor anyways has no results.
9. Abandoning quest and trying again yielded same exact behaviors and issues.

I would expect Vladeus to be able to follow you when you zone into Wetlands from Thandol Span.

comments.body:
This is a demonstration of the "bug/feature" of https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/issues/3393. Command and holy strike apply their +% damage buffs two times, which is blizzlike behavior for command. This is most clearly seen on Thaddius.

Still, this should be buffing command's damage to +200% which is triple the damage. A command crit for 8.8k might need further testing... perhaps this is +300 or +400% to get such a huge number?
Damage multipliers are (as the name implies) multiplicative. increasing damage by 100% twice is a quadrupling, not a tripling, of the damage.

Sitting infront of a dummy with huge haste and 100% crit: 
With BA, I'm critting command for 1252-1580
Without BA, I'm critting command for 328-412
Looks to be indeed a quadrupling aka 4x, so 2x twice, which is what the bug I linked states, that Holy Strike and Command double dip their +% buffs.

As command is exactly like this in 1.12, this won't be changed as a bug.

title: Some mobs and gathering nodes are unreachable, as well as some multi-zone pathing NPCs are impacted
body:
This crops up in a lot of places. We appreciate the community sharing screenshots and videos of places in the game where this issue is most apparent!

#### Background:
Continents.Instanciate is a vmangos feature that splits up the world's zones into a bunch of instances, which allows the hosting server to speed up computation with multithreading. READ: THIS IS NOT BLIZZARD'S LAYERING :)

However, the border between zones and therefore these instances is rough, and can end up with problems:

- Players may see a herb or mining node in the horizon, so they start walking to it, and suddenly the node and maybe any mobs around it suddenly dissapear. The player may think their game has just broken on them. Some will walk back and realize the node has reappeared, and will then dissapear once again once they re-approach. This can be a major pain point to players' desire to collect, these few nodes that are uncollectable stand out the hundreds and thousands they can collect normally. https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/issues/5179 https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/issues/4782 https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/issues/5706
- A spawned NPC for a quest might have a path that takes them into a new zone. These scripts do not account for the phasing and will prevent quests from being completable at all. https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/issues/5135 https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/issues/5105 . NPC follow and escort quests similarly suffer: https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/issues/5352
- The client sometimes fails to render zepplins that cross these boundaries. https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/issues/4691

body:
Hello, today I've discovered another error with the Talisman of Ascendance. when activated and casting damaging spells, it stacks and increases damage only up to the 4th stack, the fifth one instead of increasing spell damage decreases it to just the base damage of the spell (as if you were casting the spell without having active the trinket).

3. Activate the trinket and cast max Rank Shadow Word pain until you stack Ascendance Buff 4 Times (160 Spell damage), then Cast again max Rank Shadow Word pain. See how it increases the DOT damage.
4. Repeat the process but this Time Let it Stack 5 times (200 Spell damage), then cast max Rank Shadow Word pain. See how it decreases the DOT damage to the value of the 2 Point of this explanation.

title: Quest: A New Rune-Frontier removes sword from inv
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:** 
For the quest "A New Rune-Frontier" offered by Craftsman Wilhelm at Light's Hope Chapel, he asks you to craft an [Untempered Runeblade]. However, upon completion of the quest, the blade you have - whether it's equipped or not - is removed from your inventory. There is no indication that Wilhelm actually wants you to GIVE him the sword, and the rest of the questline is moreso about you collaborating with him on tempering the blade you already have. Multiple people have stated that this is bugged and requires a GM restoration of the item.

2. Craft the [Untempered Runeblade]
3. Accept the quest "A New Rune-Frontier" from Craftsman Wilhelm at Light's Hope Chapel

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**

EITHER:
A: Simply having the sword should allow the quest to be completed, it should not be removed from your inventory.

B: If this behavior is (for some insane reason) intended: Have Wilhelm state that he wants you to GIVE HIM an untempered runeblade so that he can study it. "If you can get your hands on an untempered runeblade and see it in your heart to donate it to the cause so I can study it[...]" or some similar line. The objective should also be changed from "Craft an Untempered Runeblade, and return to Craftsman Wilhelm. " to "Bring Craftsman Wilhelm an Untempered Runeblade." to make it fall in line with the format of other Blacksmithing quests. Adding a "NOTE: Wilhelm will need to hold onto the runeblade to study it.", and possibly a confirmation box of "Hand over your Untempered Runeblade?"

title: Southshore Shadowy Assassin event still not fixed
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:** 
The event which is supposed to spawn Shadowy Assassin's in Southshore is currently bugged and hasn't been fixed despite several requests from the community over the past few years, both on Github and Discord. GM's used to place the item that the Shadow Assassin's drop(Assassin's contract) in your inventory, but due to the spike in server population they no longer provide that service. As such it is impossible to do the Baron Vardus quest chain. Although I am, and will continue to be highly appreciative of the hard work the Turtle WoW dev's have done, vanilla content should be fully functioning after half a decade online. 

If fixing the event requires too much work, then an alternative should be offered. For example a permanently lootable Shadowy Assassin corpse guarded by Southshore Guard's. In practice the corpse would be a container on a fast respawn which contains the Assassin's Contract.

**Steps to reproduce the behaviour with as much detail as possible:**
Wait in Southshore for the Southshore Crier to announce the event in /yell (this normally takes place around 15-20 minutes past the hour)
Shadowy Assassin's do not spawn whatsoever, either in Blizz-like locations or in any visible custom locations.
The Southshore Crier just stands outside the Inn for about ten minutes after announcing the attack.
As the Shadowy Assassin's do not spawn, the Assassin's Contract item cannot be looted to begin the quest chain of the same name which leads to killing Baron Vardus in Alterac Mountains.

The formula for haste in this case is 
3 / (1+33%) = 2.256 round up to 2.3

to bring a 3s cast down to 2.1 you'd need 7% more haste from elsewhere:
3 / ((1+33%) * (1+7%)) = 2.108

title: Suggestions for Addressing the Viability issues of Enhancement Shaman
body:
Here are a few ideas I'd like to share on potential tweaks to the Shaman class, specifically to the Enhancement spec.
Some background for myself, I main'd an Enh Shaman throughout all of Classic, actively raiding as Enh spec during all tiers of raiding. I also currently play both an Enh and Ele shaman on Wotlk Classic.

First, I'd like to applaud the the steps already taken to better support the Enh spec, I think they are steps in the right direction.

As we've learned from [interviews from Vanilla class designers](https://youtu.be/iH7xKE0W7Pc), Enh was meant to be a primary melee DPS spec, but was released in a largely unfinished state due to the aggressive development schedule for Vanilla. From my perspective, there are four main issues that are unaddressed with the spec in the Vanilla state:
1. Mana regen issues.
2. Threat issues.
3. RNG issues with WF+2H.
4. Lack of stat scaling with spells/shocks.

These were all correspondingly addressed in TBC via:
1. Water Shield's passive mana regen + Shamanistic Rage, (on use mana regen CD).
2. Spirit Weapons, (30% threat reduction).
3. DW to smooth out WF+2H RNG.
4.  Mental Quickness, (added SP scaling with AP).

Granted these changes didn't make Enh A-tier dps by any means, however they did successfully address the core issues which were interfering with the viability of the spec as a serious melee DPS.

Re: # 1 Mana regen
This issue remains unaddressed on TWoW. While water shield was added, it did not include the passive mana regen component of the TBC version, and as Enh should not be taking direct hits as melee DPS, there is in affect no impact on mana regen while raiding. There remains a need for Enh to be able to actively regenerate mana during combat, otherwise you've got a spec which largely can't use it core abilities without going OOM and resorting to just auto-attacking. My suggestion here would be to add the passive mana regen component to Water Shield and/or add some other mechanic which enables active mana regen similar to Shamanistic Rage.

Re: # 2 Threat Issues
Enh as it currently stands on TWoW still suffers from the same threat issues as it did in Vanilla. The ratio of TPS:DPS lacks balance/parity when compared to other DPS specs. This one is an easy fix IMHO, adding a passive threat reduction talent similar to those which are currently available to most other DPS specs.

Re: # 3 WF+2H RNG issues
Personally, I enjoyed the class fantasy of Enh wielding a 2H weapon gaining a lot of satisfaction from those big chunky hits, and was sad to see the switch to DW in TBC. I think an alternate solution for the WF+2H RNG issues would be to consider the approach of a glyph from Wotlk: [Glyph of Windfury](https://www.wowhead.com/wotlk/item=41542/glyph-of-windfury-weapon) wherein the % chance for a WF proc is increased with each successive non-WF hit. Albeit the glyph as-is was designed for DW, so the +% WF bonus would have to be increased corresponding with the slow speed of 2H, but I think it merits consideration as an alternative to the DW approach.

Re: # 4 Lack of stat scaling with spells/shocks
This issue also largely remains unaddressed on TWoW, as the spec currently gears solely for melee DPS stats: AP/Melee Crit, none of which impact the effectiveness of spells/shocks. This leads to clunky attempts at gearing as "Spellhance" with a mix and match approach to gearing with both SP and Melee gear that ultimately fails in execution to yield competitive DPS, (compounded by the aforementioned mana regen issues), or else abandoning the use shocks entirely from the rotation resulting in a pretty boring playstyle IMHO: (SS every 12 secs+auto-attacks). My suggestion here would be to tweak one of the existing Enh talents to incorporate some sort of SP scaling from Melee DPS stats.

title: Blastwave not critting even on 10 Combustion stacks
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1.The DAMAGE component of the Blastwave Fire Spell seems to mostly ignore crit modifiers from Combustion Stacks.
2. Even with 10 Combustion Stacks which would grant 100% crit on Blastwave it only crits on 1 or 2 mobs in a pack of 5 instead of all 5.
3. Whilst on Flamestrike on 10 Stacks Combustion all the initial hits of Flamestrike (not the ticks) do indeed score a critical hit.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

NPC: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=
Item: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=
Quest: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=
Spell: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=
Object: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?object=

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**

When faced with 10 Combustion Stacks (100% firespellcrit) all of the Blastwave hits from one spell instance should be criting.
It should also work the same way as the Frostmage SHATTER COMBO beeing composed of Flamestrike and Cone of Cold both benefitting from the 50% frostnova critchance via spellbatching. getting the full 50% crit on both spells going of at the same time. 
Hence it should be possible for a Fire/Ice (Elemental Mage) specced Mage to Stack Combustion to 10 and do the same Combo with Flamestrike and Blastwave. resulting in 100% of crits on both spells, also using the spellbatching technique mentioned before.
It works the same way for this example:
You already scored 2 critical hits with combustion beeing active. Casting fireball followed up by a fireblast would result in both spells critting 100% of the time. Since u cast fireblast before the fireball arrives and crits both spells benefit ffrom the crit modifier.

This should work the same way with Flamestrike and Blastwave beeing cast in 1 spellbatching tick, resulting in 100% critchance for both spell instances. Giving Firemage mentionable more viability in AoE farming solo. Balancing out the big gap between fire and frost speccs.

title: The Untamed Blade possibly not on the loot table
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:** By it's nature, I can't confirm this and more of an extreme suspicion I have (hearsay, if you will). After raiding BWL for 5 months, we have seen every item drop EXCEPT The Untamed Blade, which, statistically speaking, is extremely, beyond extremely unlikely to happen. He drops 3 items on death - a T2 Bracer, one of two trinkets and one of four remaining items, including UTB. However, not only have we not gotten a single drop in 5 months without missing a single ID, others that I have talked to outside my guild have said similar things.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Kill Razorgore the Untamed in BWL. If you have an internal PTR, you can respawn and kill him as many times as you wish.
2. Loot the body and notice the constant lack of UTB (it's always Mantle of the Blackwing Cabal or Gloves of Rapid Evolution that drop. On that note, we haven't seen Spineshatter either).
3. Get frustrated.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

NPC: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=12435
Item: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?item=19334

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:** The weapon should drop. :(

title: Players get instantly unflagged from inter-faction (FFA) PvP when leaving the Gurubashi Arena.
body:
When a player enters the Gurubashi Arena they get flagged for PvP even with members of their own faction (that are not inside their party or raid). This is working as intended.

However the problem is that upon leaving the Arena they instantly get unflagged again.

This leads to extremely unhealthy gameplay scenarios where someone can just stand on the stairs and repeatedly step back and forth to attack people inside, while being almost completely safe themselves. This is especially problematic during the Gurubashi Chest event (where opening the chest can be interrupted from a safe position) and if the person doing this playing a ranged class (ideally with a lot of dots that persists to tick regardless of current alignments).

This is much different from how it worked in actual Vanilla or on retail Classic. There you stay flagged for ~10-15 seconds to avoid aforementioned issues.

body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
Temporary flying mounts in Razor Hill/Goldshire/Caverns of Time have a dismount timer which can be abused to keep one's ground mount's movement speed while being effectively dismounted which allows players to have 100+% increased run speed on foot. This effect persists while entering outdoor instances, including raids such as AQ20. The effect is not removed in combat, but is removed by changes to movement speed (slows/sprints/swapping mount speed gear) and seems to be removed by non instant casting. 

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Activate the temporary flying mount by talking to it and choosing the dialogue option - the dismount timer will activate
2. Wait at least 3-4 seconds to have enough time to mount up on your regular ground mount later
3. Activate the temporary flying mount again - a separate second dismount timer will activate
4. Wait for the first timer's dismount to trigger, now you will be on foot
5. Mount up before the second timer is up
6. If you are mounted and the second timer's dismount trigger goes off, you will keep the ground mount's movement speed buff but you will be on foot now

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
The flying mount's dismount trigger should remove any ground mount buffs, or it should not have separate dismount timers for each time the flight NPC is talked to and instead reset the first timer whenever you talk to it.

title: Its not a Bug but it is as Bad as my English :D (Scorch/Fire Vulnerability).
body:
''Improved Scorch'' can attach a ''Fire Vulnerability debuff'' on a Target and it can stack up to 5 times. Fire Vulnerability can be resisted from a Target even if ur Scorch was successful (many ppl dont know about this). Same with Winterchill and other Debuffs from Attacks.

If u hit a Target with Scorch the first 5 times, the Combatlog will track these Fire Vulnerability debuffs perfect which is important to create working tracking addons. After the 1st Scorch the Combatlog will tell u ''Mob is afflicted by Fire Vulnerability''. After the 2nd Scorch it will tell u ''Mob is afflicted by Fire Vulnerability(2) and so on. But after the 5th cast ''Mob is afflicted by Fire Vulnerability(5)'' it wont show u a Message like ''Mob is afflicted by Fire Vulnerability(5)'' again. It wont track anything if there are already 5 Stacks(Max amount) of Fire Vulnerability on the Target. Thats a 1.12 Client Combatlog Thing.

All Addons, All Interfaces are just tracking the ''Scorch-Hits''. So even if ur Fire Vulnerability has been resistet the Timer (BigWigs and so on) will jump back to 30sec after ur Scorch did Damage. But no Mage want to track Scorch. They want to track the Fire Vulnerability debuff attached from the Scorch and they dont want the timer to jump back to 30 when that Fire Vulnerability debuff has been resistet. They have Addons for this in the Classic remake (not a 1.12 Client) which can track resisted Fire Vulnerability debuffs.

Just imagen. U have 5 Stacks on a Boss and they run out in 5 sec > U cast a Scorch to refresh it > Ur Scorchtimer jumps back to 30 sec bc ur Scorch was hitting the Target but the Fire Vulnerability has been resists so u just loose all ur Stacks of Fire Vulnerability bc there is no way to track resisted Fire Vulnerability debuffs. Atm i just cast Scorch 2 times to refresh the Fire Vulnerability as a workaround.

As u all know Turtle wow has more than 16 debuff slots. I see Debuffs on the Mob but i cant see Stacks of the 17th applied debuff (Shagu-Tweaks). If my 5 Stacks run out, there are already to many debuffs on the mob (in Bossfights) from other player so i cant see any of my Fire Vulnerability stacks it event wont show me a single Fire Vulnerability if there are already to many debuffs on the Target. Atm i just cast 5x Scorch blind as workaround.

As a Frostmage u just dont have to care about this Problem bc Winterchill will get applied by Frostbolt and u spam Frostbolts all day but as Fire Mage where u have to us a specific cast (Scorch) for that its rly suboptimal.

Can we fix the Combatlog somehow on that 1.12 client to make it show Stack tracking after (5/Max amount)? Or can we change the Mage Firebolt to make it not attach but at least refresh that fire vulnerability?. Can we make Fire Vulnerability unresistable?. Its not like its unplayable but i understand why many mages rater spamming frostbolts than haveing problems with debuffsstacks running out.

On Nostalrius we had the same Problem but if the Fire Vulnerability stacks did run out we where able to see how many Fire Vulnerability Stacks we reapplied bc other ppl where not allowed to use dots. I cant see Stacks if there are more then 16 debuffs and i cant see any debuff it there are more than 32 debuffs on the Target. (Shagun-Tweaks / Debufffilter / BigWigs).

I was talking to many mages and most of them didnt even realised the Problem with the resistance of Fire Vulnerability. I have no clue how highend raider faceing this problem. I saw that 5 Stacks of Fire Vulnerability running out in Raid which had 3+ Fire Mages bc they think its enough if only 1 mage reapplied that Fire Vulnerability(which can be resisted) Stacks by casting 1 single Scorch. The Talentstree tells u ''Improved Scorch 3/3 = 100% Chance to attach a Fire Vulnerability'' and if they dont know that this debuff can be resisted they trust the blizzard tooltips and loose 15% of fire dmg.

title: Hunter pets attack new targets without instruction
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**

Sometimes when fighting, as soon at the pet's target dies, a hunter's pet will take off and attack another target without being instructed to do so. This happens even when tabbed targeting is not used and the pet is set to "Passive." Today, I was fighting on the plains of The Barrens (flat surface, with no "floors" above or below me, so not a "path issue"), and my bird took off after a fight and disappeared completely (flying far out of sight). I called it back, and it brought the mob it had targeted. There's no way I could have targeted something that was too far away to display on my screen. Not only that, my cursor had not been pointing anywhere near that direction the entire fight.

So far, this has happened at least three times in two days with my bird. I don't recall seeing it happen with my boar, though I have wondered at times why my various pets targeted another mob immediately after a fight. I assumed then that it was because it was set to "Defensive" mode and I had gotten aggro. But in the most recent cases, I know this could not have been the case.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Fight mobs with pet, and avoid using tabbed targeting.
2. Kill the mob.
3. On rare occasions, the pet will take off to fight a random, remote target.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

N/A

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**

Pets should only attack when instructed and not find their own targets. This can (and has) caused problems in dungeons. While some hunters do make mistakes and are careless with their pets, this bug can give even good hunters a bad rap.

Update: I have not seen this bug with my boar, but only with my bird so far. Since my bird is a bald eagle, there is a chance that this is somehow related to its new skin.

The First Aid Anti-Venoms don't share a cooldown with each other and they cleanse all poisons regardless of the poison spell's level.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**
1. Get a level 60 poison spell debuff on you (like from Silithus or AQ40 etc).

title: Bloodsail Buccaneers rep issues
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
Doing Garfield Sparkblast's Red Flag Over the Sea questline turns the Bloodsail Buccaneer neutral ( and later friendly ) to you, yet because of questing in Gadgestan you may unintendedly end up hated with them again.

This may be an issue because 
a. You may have risked death ( or died ) to the Baron's guards in order to experience those new custom quests on the Jaguero Isle, only to have the possibility of leveling there disapearing unintendedly because of leveling in Tanaris right after STV ( very common path ) 
b. You can end up being hated by both the pirates and booty bay

It should be possible to regain rep for these guys, maybe with a turn in just like the Cartel cloth NPCS, to avoid being stuck in an unwanted, awkward leveling position towards both factions.


**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Do the questline from Garfield Sparkblast in Booty bay
2. Do a couple of quests from Gadgeztan
3. Bloodsail Bucaneers are unfriendly with you again
4. No way of grinding it back up. Goodbye Jaguero isle custom questing :(

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

NPC: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=60453
Quest: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=40172

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**

You shouldn't lose rep with the Bloodsail Buccaneers by questing elsewhere than Booty bay; OR you should be given an option farm it back up, and not lose out on the Bloodsail rep entirely for a mistake.
